text: Charles-Avila Wilson (December 10, 1869 - April 7, 1936) was a Canadian lawyer, politician, and judge. Born in Île Bizard, Quebec, Wilson was a lawyer by profession. He was elected to the House of Commons of Canada for the electoral district of Laval in the 1908 federal election. A Liberal, he was re-elected in the 1911 federal election. He was later appointed a judge. ==References== * Category:1869 births Category:1936 deaths Category:Liberal Party of Canada MPs Category:Members of the House of Commons of Canada from Quebec Category:People from L'Île-Bizard–Sainte-Geneviève
title: Charles-Avila Wilson
